topic.title: Linter
topic.description: Linter is used for code style consistency and easier to understand and maintain codebases.

topic.title: Build scripts
topic.description: Xcode offers the possibility to run user defined code as part of the build process using the "Run Script Phase" in the "Build Phases" section.

topic.title: Multiple Schemes and Targets
topic.description: An Xcode project can have multiple schemes or targets.

topic.title: Config files and build
topic.description: Learn more about xcconfig files and build config.

topic.title: SOLID
topic.description: SOLID is an acronym for the first five object-oriented design (OOD) principles by Robert C. Martin

topic.title: Coordinators Pattern
topic.description: Using the coordinator pattern in iOS apps lets us remove the job of app navigation from our view controllers, helping make them more manageable and more reusable, while also letting us adjust our app's flow whenever we need.

topic.title: Frameworks Extraction
topic.description: Extract modules of the app in different frameworks (Networking, UI, Database etc.)

topic.title: Design Patterns
topic.description: Software Design Patterns - Advantages and disadvantages

topic.title: Services, Locators and Shared Protocols
topic.description: Learn what they are, when and how to use them.

topic.title: RMVVM + RxSwift
topic.description: Functional Reactive Programming. Get your hands dirty with this.

topic.title: Fastlane
topic.description:
fastlane is an open source platform aimed at simplifying Android and iOS deployment.
fastlane lets you automate every aspect of your development and release workflow. https://www.raywenderlich.com/233168-fastlane-tutorial-getting-started
